meanings.definition: To make a dull sound when struck or dropped.
meanings.sent1: I heard the pot dunting against the floor.
meanings.sent2: The hammer dunted loudly on the metal surface.
meanings.sent3: The dunting of the book falling made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops dunted on the roof like tiny drums.
meanings.sent5: The bell dunted softly in the distance, signaling the end of the day.

meanings.definition: The act of making a dull sound when struck or dropped.
meanings.sent1: The dunting of the glass breaking startled us.
meanings.sent2: The constant dunting of the construction work was annoying.
meanings.sent3: The dunting of the door closing echoed through the hallway.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic dunting of the clock filled the room with a comforting sound.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected dunting of the vase shattering caught everyone's attention.
